org.trimou.handlebars

Interface Options

  • All Superinterfaces:
    HelperDefinition

    public interface Options
extends HelperDefinition
    This objects represents a helper execution context. A new instance is created for every execution. It is not thread-safe.
    Since:
    1.5
    Author:
    Martin Kouba

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Options.HelperExecutable
      A helper task to be executed asynchronously.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.trimou.handlebars.HelperDefinition

        HelperDefinition.ValuePlaceholder

      Proceed with execution, i.e. execute the block.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        void append(CharSequence sequence)
        Append the given sequence to the rendered template. The seqence is not modified in any way.
        Parameters:
        sequence -

      • fn

        void fn()
        Proceed with template execution, i.e. execute the block. This is no-op for variable tag helpers.

      • partial

        void partial(String name)
        Render the template with the current context and append the result to the rendered template.
        Parameters:
        name -
        Throws:
        MustacheException - If there's no such template
        See Also:
        Mustache.getName()

      • source

        String source(String name)
        Parameters:
        name -
        Returns:
        the source of the mustache template
        Throws:
        MustacheException - If there's no such template
        Since:
        1.6
        See Also:
        Mustache.getName()

      • push

        void push(Object contextObject)
        Push the specified object on the context stack. Helper should pop all pushed objects at the end of its execution. Otherwise all remaining objects will be removed automatically.
        Parameters:
        contextObject -

      • pop

        Object pop()
        Removes the object at the top of the context stack and returns that object.
        Returns:
        the object at the top of the context stack
        Throws:
        MustacheException - In case of a helper tries to pop a context object it did not push previously

      • peek

        Object peek()
        Returns the object at the top of the context stack without removing it.
        Returns:
        the object at the top of the context stack
        Since:
        1.6

      • getAppendable

        Appendable getAppendable()
        In most cases it's better to use the convenient method append(CharSequence) instead.
        Returns:
        The appendable to append the rendered template to
        Since:
        1.7
        See Also:
        Mustache.render(Appendable, Object)

      • fn

        void fn(Appendable appendable)
        Proceed with execution, i.e. execute the block. This is no-op for variable tag helpers.
        Parameters:
        appendable - The appendable to append the rendered block to
        Since:
        1.7

      • getValue

        Object getValue(String key)
        The key is first processed by the KeySplitter and then processed by the resolver chain.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        the value from the context for the given key, or null if no such value exists
        Since:
        1.8
        See Also:
        KeySplitter

      • partial

             Appendable appendable)
        Render the template with the current context and append the result to the given appendable.
        Parameters:

        Throws:
        MustacheException - If there's no such template

      • getOriginalDefinition

        HelperDefinition getOriginalDefinition()
        Returns:
        the original helper definition whose params and hash map may contain value placeholders
        Since:
